snippet: Two H.I.V.-infected patients who had bone-marrow transplants for blood cancers have apparently been virus-free since they stopped taking antiretroviral drugs.
abstract: Two HIV-infected patients in Boston who had bone-marrow transplants for blood cancers have apparently been virus-free for weeks since their antiretroviral drugs were stopped.
lead_paragraph: Two H.I.V.-infected patients who had bone-marrow transplants for blood cancers have apparently been virus-free since they stopped taking antiretroviral drugs.

headline.main: After Marrow Transplants, 2 More Patients Appear H.I.V.-Free Without Drugs
headline.print_headline: After Marrow Transplants, 2 More Patients Appear H.I.V.-Free Without Drugs
